definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: A dwarf minke whale swims near Australia's Great Barrier Reef .
sentences.chinese: 一頭小鬚鯨正在澳大利亞大堡礁附近遊弋。

sentences.english: With more than 600 islands and coral cays, the reef covers more than 300, 000 sq.
sentences.chinese: 大堡礁有超過600個島嶼與珊瑚礁岩。

sentences.english: Divers have to be careful on the Great Barrier Reef.
sentences.chinese: 潛水者身處大堡礁時必須小心在巨大堡礁謹慎。

sentences.english: For holidays , many people visit the Great Barrier Reef off the northest coast of Australia .
sentences.chinese: 假期的時候，很多人都去參觀澳大利亞北部的大堡礁。

sentences.english: The islands are surrounded by barrier reefs that are home to hundreds of unusual and exotic creatures.
sentences.chinese: 環繞羣島的大堡礁，蘊育了好幾百種珍奇的海洋生物。

sentences.english: The SeaQuest ADV offers you the chance to dive the very best of the Outer Barrier Reef in absolute comfort and style.
sentences.chinese: 她讓您以最舒適和時尚的方式潛泳在外大堡礁最佳處。

sentences.english: You can also take a bareboat from Cairns to the outer Greater Barrier Reef.
sentences.chinese: 您還可以從凱恩斯包租空船，自己駛往大堡礁的外礁。

sentences.english: The Great Barrier Reef is a World Heritage-listed natural wonder.
sentences.chinese: 大堡礁是列入世界遺產名錄的自然奇觀。

definition: Republic of Palau or Belau (Pacific island nation)

pinyin: Jia1 la1 pa4 ge1 si1 Qun2 dao3

definition: Fiji, country in the southwest Pacific Ocean
Uluru, massive sandstone outcrop in central Australia
Bora Bora, island of the Society Islands group in French Polynesia
name of various places including Gold Coast (Australian city), Gold Coast (former British colony in Africa) and Costa Daurada (area on the coast of Catalonia, Spain)
